title: Ryze's power scaling
body:
I think it's time Ryze's Q got the Vlad treatment and the CD scaled per level invested heavily. 
Right now Ryze is supposed to be one of those AOE burst, DPS tanky mages that's god tier in the late game. For this heavy scaling he's too oppressive as a ranged character especially in the early game and his lvl 1 persistant harass potential needs to be toned down.

Thought?

replies.body:
I think this is a very reasonable idea, but I don't think the cooldown should not be too high at early levels because he should not be forced into maxing his core ability first, as opposed to right now where you can max his other abilities for different benefits (stronger snare or more MR reduction and multitarget damage). At the most, it should be no higher than 6-4 seconds.

Also, Overload technically does currently have a cooldown that scales with rank, on the technicality that it gives passive CDR.

Realistically, he is almost completely forced into maxing his Q right now. The other builds don't offer as much (stronger snare doesn't matter much if you don't hurt, MR reduction hurts less than stright damage early and multitarget is still outdamaged by Q spam).
I think the base damage could be nerfed, to make his early game less oppressive for such a hyperscaling champ.
Next patch, the base damage of Overload gets reduced by 20 on all  levels, in addition to {{item:1054}} also working against single-target spells.
IMO, Ryze's hyperscale should start a bit later, right now he gets there far to quickly. In my opinion.

Honestly though he shouldn't just become scary entirely because he leveled 1 ability.

He should become scary through itemization, but when that same itemization that gives him great power is also a tank build you have a huge problem.

I agree with him. ^
Yeah, I think that will be a solid adjustment to Ryze.
The Dorans shield buff is a nerf to Ryze by itself
